Cepo 0.0.1

  • Changelog

Computing (trend-)Limma cell identity genes

DE-cell-identity-methods.Rd

exprsMat accepts various matrix objects, including DelayedArray and HDF5Array for out-of-memory computations.

doLimma(exprsMat, cellTypes)

doVoom(exprsMat, cellTypes)

doTtest(exprsMat, cellTypes)

doWilcoxon(exprsMat, cellTypes)

Arguments

exprsMat

expression matrix where columns denote cells and rows denote genes
cellTypes

vector of cell type labels

Value

Returns a list, each element corresponds to statistics (and p-values) associated with a cell-type

Examples

set.seed(1234)
n = 50 ## genes, rows
p = 100 ## cells, cols
exprsMat = matrix(rpois(n*p, lambda = 5), nrow = n)
rownames(exprsMat) = paste0("gene", 1:n)
colnames(exprsMat) = paste0("cell", 1:p)
cellTypes = sample(letters[1:3], size = p, replace = TRUE)

doLimma(exprsMat = exprsMat, cellTypes = cellTypes)

#> $stats
#> DataFrame with 50 rows and 3 columns
#>                a         b         c
#>        <numeric> <numeric> <numeric>
#> gene46   2.97407 -1.433649 -1.849752
#> gene38   2.50385 -3.848203  1.258802

#> gene12   1.15447 -2.027285  0.859346
